  * "The Return of the King" (1982) - This movie is based on J.R.R.Tolkien's novel "The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring" (1951). The story follows a hobbit named Frodo Baggins, who lives with his uncle Bilbo and his companions Merry Brandybuck and Pippin Carrotfoot. The film explores themes such as heroism, friendship, love, sacrifice, and redemption. Some notable actors in this movie include: Ian McKellen as Gandalf and Chris Patten as King Richard of England.

  * "Where the Red Fern Grows" (1961) - This movie is based on the novel of the same name by Anna Sewell. The story follows a young orphan girl named Sophie Foster, who lives with her uncle Bilbo and their companions Merry Brandybuck and Pippin Carrotfoot. The film explores themes such as love, friendship, sacrifice, and redemption. Some notable actors in this movie include: Elizabeth Taylor as Sophie Foster and Richard Widmark as Uncle Bilbo.

  * "The BFG" (1982) - This movie is based on J.R.R.Tolkien's novel "The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King" (1951). The story follows a young orphan girl named Sophie Foster, who lives with her uncle Bilbo and their companions Merry Brandybuck and Pippin Carrotfoot. The film explores themes such as love, friendship, sacrifice, and redemption. Some notable actors in this movie include: Richard Harris as Grandfather and Ben Kingsley as Captain Underwood.
